alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 30 at 9:53AM EST until January 02 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Little Falls affecting Passaic and Essex Counties. Passaic River Above Singac affecting Passaic, Essex and Morris Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Passaic, Essex and Morris Counties. For the Passaic River...including Little Falls, Pine Brook, Singac... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River at Pine Brook. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Street flooding begins in Fairfield including Camp Lane Road. Two Bridges Road is closed going into Lincoln Park and Wayne. At 19.5 feet, Horseneck Road in Fairfield is subject to flooding and closures. At 20.0 feet, Eagle Rock Avenue in Roseland is subject to flooding. Camp Lane Road, River Edge Drive and Broadway Lane in Fairfield are flooded. Stewart Place is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EST Saturday the stage was 19.8 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM EST Saturday was 19.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning and continue falling to 18.9 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.8 feet on 01/21/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Stg Time Date Passaic River Pine Brook 19.0 19.8 Sat 9 am 19.4 19.2 Crested & Falling &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM EST.
